All Implemented Interfaces:
BinarySentenceProposition, Proposition, SentenceProposition
public class DisjunctiveProposition
extends AbstractProposition
implements BinarySentenceProposition

Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach (3rd Edition): Formula 13.4, page 489.

We can also derive the well-known formula for the probability of a disjunction, sometimes called the inclusion-exclusion principle:

P(a OR b) = P(a) + P(b) - P(a AND b).

Author:
Ciaran O'Reilly

Description copied from interface: Proposition
Determine whether or not the proposition holds in a particular possible world.

Specified by:
holds in interface Proposition
Specified by:
holds in class AbstractProposition
Parameters:
possibleWorld - A possible world is defined to be an assignment of values to all of the random variables under consideration.
Returns:
true if the proposition holds in the given possible world, false otherwise.
